results.title: Unemployment
results.creator_credit: Graeme Turner, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Making Sense of Society”.
Presents two real-life cases of individuals who have actually experienced being unemployed. Dave Hunt of Sunderland has been out of work for 8 years. John Lockyer of Watford was unemployed for 4 months in 1971 but has been continuously in employment since then. Demonstrates the effect unemployment has had on their lives and their families.

results.title: Power in society: San Francisco bay area rapid transit winning public support
results.creator_credit: Graeme Turner, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Making Sense of Society”.
Looks at the setting up of a rapid transit system in San Francisco and the actions of the various county councils involved. Examines the roles of individuals within these organizations, their interactions and different levels of power and influence in participating in this scheme.

results.title: Mugging: a case study in communication
results.creator_credit: Victor Lockwood and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Making Sense of Society”.
Looks at the press coverage of “mugging” to illustrate some points about the social nature of mass communications. Brings together and connects the two themes of communication and crime. Stuart Hall, of the University of Birmingham looks at and discusses these issues.
results.description:

results.title: The Story of the toy soldier
results.creator_credit: Brian Cosgrove and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Magic ball”
Sam is playing with his tin soldiers. While placing them in lines, he notices that one of his soldiers keeps falling over. Sam is perplexed, so the magic ball takes him to a parade ground where the soldiers are being drilled by a sergeant and a corporal.

results.title: The Story of the six winged lions
results.creator_credit: Brian Cosgrove and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Magic ball”
Sam looks at a Chinese plate. The picture shows somone big, helped by six winged lions, to bully a smaller person. Sam decides to use the power of the magic ball, and do something about it.

results.title: The Story of the pirates
results.creator_credit: Brian Cosgrove and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Magic ball”
Presents a fantasy about a boy who is transported to the high seas by a magic ball. Shows how he joins with an old fisherman in foiling the attempts of a group of pirates to bury their treasure. For primary grades.

results.title: The Story of the grandfather clock
results.creator_credit: Brian Cosgrove and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Magic ball”
Sam noticed that the grandfather clock had stopped. The magic ball made him very small and he went through the keyhole of the clock. There he saw people.
